content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting operations.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (Working) (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water.
• Boiler (Original) (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Provides steam when fueled (currently out of fuel).
• Boiler (Repositioned) (position: 10.0, 6.5) – Fueled with coal; not connected (no input liquid, no fluid present in connections).
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; not connected (not linked to the power network, lacks input liquid and fluid connections).
• Electricity Network – Composed of small electric poles linking and distributing power among production components.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – Comprised of small electric poles linking production components.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Boiler Repositioning Placement Failures  
 - Candidate areas (e.g., around (2.5,5.5), (3.0,5.5), (3.5,8.5), (4.0,9.0)) repeatedly fail placement checks even after clearing obstructive pipe groups.  
 - Tip: Fully clear and verify buildability of candidate regions before repositioning attempts.

• Fluid Connection Errors  
 - Attempts to connect the Offshore Pump (at -7.5, 25.5) to the original Boiler (at 2.0, 17.5) and the Boiler to the Steam Engine (at 5.5, 5.5) resulted in “no valid connections,” indicating blocked or misaligned connection points.  
 - Tip: Before attempting connections, ensure that both source and target connection points are unobstructed and compatible.

• nearest_buildable() Invocation Issues  
 - An error (“TypeError: 'Position' object is not callable”) occurred when using nearest_buildable to find a buildable area for Boiler placement.  
 - Tip: Confirm that the nearest_buildable function is properly defined and called, and that no Position objects are being mistakenly invoked as functions.

• Previous API and Environment-Related Pitfalls  
 - Research and Science Pack Errors: Ensure automation research prerequisites are completed and that all required science pack ingredients (e.g., iron-gear-wheels) are available.  
 - Offshore Pump, Boiler Repositioning, and Pipeline Connection Errors: Verify water tile suitability and clearance before placing an Offshore Pump; confirm candidate positions are buildable and unobstructed prior to repositioning boilers.  
 - Pipe Crafting and Intermediate Node Placement Errors: Validate that sufficient iron plates are in inventory and that placement locations for piping or inserters are unoccupied.  
 - API Usage and Undefined Function Pitfalls: Use only defined API functions (such as get_entity and rotate_entity) for adjusting entity positions, and always validate entity retrievals to maintain proper workflow.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
 Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position. Returns the entity on success; raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
 Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
 Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct alignment during placement.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• new_pump_pos (Position) – Stores the target position for attempted offshore pump repositioning.
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Computed distance between designated start and end positions during manual pipeline construction.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of current inventory item counts after recent crafting and placement attempts.
